name: places/ChIJCf4vSOZYwokRK7hhiKkVLYk
formattedAddress: 351 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 351 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022-1599, USA

originalText.text: I needed a short term lease while waiting for my apartment to be renovated which kept getting delayed. Zaure and the team (Mostafa, Hussein, Reza, Tariq) provided a convenient and fuss free furnished apartment for me and my cat for 7 months! Zaure always responded quickly and fairly to my requests. This was the first time I used a shared laundry room and the machines were very clean and well maintained… probably because the laundry shop downstairs uses them and keeps them in shape. The courtyard provides a nice space to get some fresh air and is well landscaped in the warmer months. I enjoyed having my meals looking out of the window. The location was convenient and safe. Trader Joes right outside was a huge bonus. I was on a budget and for the price The Bridge Suites was, the place worked for me. The compound is definitely on the older side and not brand new/shiny like a new built but the interiors are clean, has everything you need and it is safe which was most critical for me. You’d probably have to pay 3-4 times for something brand new so it’s all about choices and expectations. Am grateful for the time I stayed there!

originalText.text: I stayed In the Bridge Suites for a month, from mid April to mid May and I had an incredible stay in the studio I stayed. Not only was it super, clean but the place had all I needed for my month long stay. I  had a beautiful view of the bridge across the street and some of the neighboring buildings. Such a great experience. The place comes with all that you need. No need to worry about buying pots, pans, plates, cups, silverware, etc. It comes equipped fully. If you need anything for your stay, chances that what you need is at front desk are pretty high. The staff is super friendly. The location of these suites is perfect, as all you need is nearby. I would 100% stay here again.

originalText.text:
I had stayed at Bridge Suites for about a year ( my move to a more permanent place was somewhat delayed)  and have positive things to say about the building and especially its staff.
People that work here are helpful, friendly, and try their best to serve their tenants. I felt at home and comfortable throughout my whole stay.
My favorite place to spend time was the lovely courtyard in the middle of the building complex--I spent many times enjoying my cigars and socializing with other friendly tenants.
If I had to return again, I would without any hesitations.

originalText.text: The bridge suites provided us a comfortable cozy brick walled apartment. Overall, it was reasonable and the location was perfect for commute since the subway was only a few blocks away. The staff members were friendly and attentive to our needs. Our stay for 5 months was easy and problem free. We got our deposit back the day before we moved out. They provide apartments for a short term which worked out for us as well. Highly recommended!

originalText.text: This place is an overpriced dump! The apartment was old and small with major repairs needed. During my stay there were maintenance issues which were not addressed.  The dumpsters are way too close to entryways which was a breeding place for mice. There were even mice in the apartment. The washers and dryers were old in a dark and dingy laundry room. With all the trouble experienced, I requested a discount on the rent and though they were aware of my complaints, they denied my request to discount the rent. The place is overpriced, filthy and low on service. This was a total waste of money!
